tweets.text:
Calling all #Christmas cooks & pot washers!

If you‚Äôre cooking or doing the dishes this festive season take 3 easy steps:

üçóPour leftover cooking fats into a heat proof container          

üçóüçóLeave to cool

üçóüçóüçóScrape into the food waste recycling or bin

#DontFeedAFatberg https://t.co/g4PL47G7X4

River Yare at Thuxton looking horrendous after a bit of rain. Mud coming from fields & building sites - mostly preventable.  Shocking DIY grups straight into the main channel (Highways?) making it much worse @N_Rivers_Trust @EnvAgencyAnglia @NENorfolkSufflk @YareWildlife https://t.co/4OnuMWJ0lN

This festive period remember to stay safe and avoid driving through flood water. It‚Äôs not worth the risk.

Know what to do in a flood: https://t.co/vhT6xEotas

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/OUKLjDzl4i
The helicopter has arrived and ballast is now being dropped in to the Canal to try and stem the flow from the breach. @CRTYorkshireNE @EnvAgencyYNE @kiergroup @ERfloodrisk https://t.co/NZ7bhmAVg4

Next phase of works at Cowick now already underway as helicopter continues its task with a haul road being installed to get machinery and materials across to the work area. @EnvAgencyYNE @kiergroup @CRTYorkshireNE @ERfloodrisk https://t.co/psvB4XAJYh

Our Chair @EmmaHowardBoyd‚Äôs full statement on part of the #RiverWharfe becoming a designated bathing water:

‚ÄúToday‚Äôs landmark decision to designate a river as a bathing water marks a first for England and could lead to a step change for water quality in the River Wharfe."

(1/3)

Flood Alert Update 6am 23/12/2020.

Slash Ln Sileby is Impassable & Closed üöß due to Flooding ‚ö†Ô∏è

Other Flood prone roads are currently Clear ‚úÖ but use Caution ‚ö†Ô∏è as the situation may change during the day. https://t.co/cfP4ikm1C5

@EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK And now the @EnvAgency will have to start properly regulating the water industry, at least on that stretch of the River Wharfe.

That too will be a first.

‚ÄúFrom small acorns...‚Äùüå≥ 

We‚Äôve been overwhelmed with stories from Yorkshire folk across the world that have dedicated trees to be planted in Yorkshire for their loved ones. Today thanks to @AmandaOwen8 & @ydmt we planted even more.

Dedicate one today at https://t.co/MFOCNStmdQ https://t.co/wPER3nAKtc

A major milestone has been achieved - Mytholmroyd's new flood defences are ready for winter to better protect 400 homes & businesses.

Thank you to the local community for their patience during the construction of this important & complex ¬£41m scheme.

https://t.co/RBitmIFTRX https://t.co/ygj1bskYIv

tweets.text:
For every one million turkeys we cook, around 250 tonnes of fats could be poured down the sink. 

Leftover cooking fats can harden in cold pipes and create blockages, increasing the risk of sewer flooding.  

Instead leave to cool, then scrape into the bin. https://t.co/x4S4yCfeUE

Huge news for #Calderdale @Calderdale as we face multiple challenges. Thank you for all the hard work & partnership @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgency #resilience #collaboration #InItTogether https://t.co/o3Smwqef5m

Loving my photo from Team @EnvAgencyYNE today, a nice socially distanced Mytholmroyd meet to check out the tail end of the scheme, we're almost there! @PaulSwaz @ScottAPatient @cathseal1 @Calderdale @VolkerStevinUK @johncurtinEA https://t.co/o62lH8xeCF

tweets.text:
#Somerset levels & Moors: The Met office have issued a yellow warning for rain across the South West tomorrow.
We are moving our temporary pumps to Currymoor, ready to pump water off the moors when needed over the Christmas period & when levels in the River Tone allow
#Floodaware https://t.co/xaTDDb91qq

Heavy rain is expected across the south of England, parts of the Midlands, Lincolnshire and East Anglia on Wednesday and Thursday. This could lead to flooding.

Stay safe and don‚Äôt walk or drive through flood water.

Sign up to get warnings in England: https://t.co/P5d6Axp8Vq https://t.co/ForWYmQhK8
https://t.co/uRmFFx8qWq Time to act to protect the River Beult SSSI @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @KentWildlife @CPREKent @theriverstrust @SE_Rivers_Trust #welovechainhurst

Used by @EnvAgency to find the level, direction & flow rate of ground water to assess the possible impact of pollutants on our water supply, wetlands and rivers. tweets.text: @Plasmadreamer @TM_WRT @YorkshireWater @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife @bradfordmdc @YorkDalesRT @CLAtweets Around hull we had lots of open drains which the victorians built to stop flooding. In the last few years developers have decided to build on them now we floodüò°. They were out there for a purpose

üéâ Hooray!!! üéâ 

Cannot overstate the importance of this decision for our rivers. Good Call @EnvAgency @DefraWater

Congratulations @CleanIlkley and all involved. You will be an inspiration. Looking forward to many surveys being carried out on many rivers for 2021 applications. https://t.co/WaDxjc18t1

tweets.text: @offy_bromley @TM_WRT @YorkshireWater @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife @bradfordmdc @YorkDalesRT @CLAtweets Nature calls it a floodplain, the areas developers seem comfortable to build on.

@TamFinkelstein @EnvAgency The humble dipmeter in action in the field. A vital piece of equipment for every #hydrogeologist measuring the #groundwater table in our #aquifers & we have many in @GeoscienceEA üëç #Defragroupin100objects Show us your best dipmeter photo! https://t.co/8ezh5VS6Pl

@offy_bromley @TM_WRT @YorkshireWater @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife @bradfordmdc @YorkDalesRT @CLAtweets I have worked on flood relief schemes in Northumberland. Rivers were often ‚Äòdredged‚Äô to win material to strengthen floodbanks but our biggest weapon to reduce flooding was the creation of upstream sacrificial flood areas to store water during times of heavy rainfall.
@TM_WRT @YorkshireWater @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife @bradfordmdc @YorkDalesRT @CLAtweets Rivers will have more depth to hold more water banks higher again holds more water thus less flooding
@N_Rivers_Trust @frogsatuea @EnvAgencyAnglia @NENorfolkSufflk @YareWildlife Only solution can see is taking lots of land out of production. Its been going on for decades.

In Defence of the Flood Plain, Canvey Island the Special Case! @CastlePointBC @floodmary @EnvAgency 
https://t.co/nP3drLhsQk via @wordpressdotcom
We're working with the @EnvAgency through the festive period to help spread awareness about what to do in a #flooding event. Check out this short video #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/Heoq1G2HKG
@frogsatuea @EnvAgencyAnglia @NENorfolkSufflk @YareWildlife River Glaven looking much the same. Hoping to find trout spawning, but not when the water is this colour. https://t.co/dVlxdWwJ7S
